de.oth.hsp.common.dat

Class AbstractDatFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.oth.hsp.common.dat.AbstractDatFile
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ClspDatFile, HpplanStatDatFile

    public abstract class AbstractDatFile
extends java.lang.Object
    Children of this class represent certain kinds .dat files.

    When implementing a new model class make sure to call initialize() at the end of its constructor.
    Author:
    Thomas Butz

        public abstract java.util.List<AbstractConstraint> getConstraints()
        Returns:
        an ordered and unmodifiable List of AbstractConstraint objects which define relationships between entries

      • ensureConstraints

        public void ensureConstraints()
                       throws ConstraintException
        Ensures that all given Constraints are satisfied.
        Throws:
        ConstraintException - if one or more DatEntry object contain a values which makes it impossible to satisfy the constraints

      • validate

        public void validate()
              throws ConstraintException
        Checks if all AbstractConstraint relations are being satisfied.
        Throws:
        ConstraintException - if one ore more Constraints are not being satisfied

      • saveAs

        public void saveAs(java.nio.file.Path path,
                   boolean allowOverride)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Tries to save current content at the the specified location.
        Parameters:
        path - the location the content should be saved to
        allowOverride - true if the method is allowed to override existing files, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an existing file is to be overwritten while allowOverride is set to false or a general IOException was thrown while trying to write to the file

      • createTempModFile

        Creates a temporary mod file which fits to this file.
        Returns:
        the Path to the temporary mod file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occured while creating the file
